main_definition: To perceive or experience a sensation, emotion, or state of being through touch, intuition, or internal awareness.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To physically sense an object or surface with one's hands
meanings_and_examples.example: I can feel the smoothness of the silk fabric.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To emotionally experience a particular feeling such as happiness, sadness, or anger
meanings_and_examples.example: She felt overjoyed when she received the good news about her promotion.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have an intuitive understanding or perception of something without using logic
meanings_and_examples.example: He could feel that there was trouble brewing in their relationship, even though he didn't know exactly what it was.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be affected by a certain condition or disease
meanings_and_examples.example: The patient felt weak and dizzy after taking the medication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To become aware of something through personal experience, rather than knowledge obtained externally
meanings_and_examples.example: I didn't realize how hard it was until I saw her struggle to carry all those bags by herself.
